body: Hi, thanks for the report. I'd recommend opening an issue on the [`flat-cache`](https://github.com/royriojas/flat-cache) package instead, since that's where the `circular-json` dependency is declared.

Hi @zefexdeveloper, thanks for this issue.

As you can see, this is an indirect dependency. It would be more useful to file an issue in the flat-cache and/or file-entry-cache repositories to ensure they consume the new package; then ESLint can upgrade file-entry-cache to consume the new package as well.

Would you mind filing issues in those repositories? Thanks!
Looks like this is in the process of being addressed: royriojas/flat-cache#23
@platinumazure Thank you for the rapid response, I saw that you comment there as well.

labels.name: build
labels.description: This change relates to ESLint's build process

labels.name: accepted
labels.description: There is consensus among the team that this change meets the criteria for inclusion

labels.name: archived due to age
labels.description: This issue has been archived; please open a new issue for any further discussion

repository.name: eslint
repository.description: Find and fix problems in your JavaScript code.

body: @zefexdeveloper @platinumazure the upgrade broke the eslint build https://github.com/eslint/eslint/issues/11062, I had to revert the upgrade. Will reopen the ticket.

@royriojas Thank you very much, it looks like everything is good to go now right?

https://github.com/eslint/eslint/issues/11062#issuecomment-437173066

hi @zefexdeveloper technically not. Since the revert is forcing us to still use circular-json. I will release a new major version of `flat-cache` that includes the change to flatted and make a PR to upgrade the unit tests of eslint. Worst side effect I believe this could introduce is that during the upgrade the previous cache format won't be read correctly and will be discarded. 

I need to confirm that is the behavior, it would be in my opinion the best way to handle the obsolete cache format.

I'll reopen this.

@royriojas Kind of weird that flatted writes JSON differently for the same input when flatted is supposed to be the replacement for circular-json. Maybe their API is a bit different. Does flatted have documentation around a migration path from circular-json, I wonder?

At any rate, I think there's probably a way to preserve the current cache format... somehow :smile: We just need to find it!

If I get time this weekend, I can try to help dig in. Sorry I didn't provide a lot of help on the initial upgrade attempt.

issue.title: warning when delete yarn.lock

repository.name: create-react-app
repository.description: Set up a modern web app by running one command.

issue.body:
<!--
  PLEASE READ THE FIRST SECTION :-)
-->

### Is this a bug report?
Yes.

When i create app with `create-react-app appname` and then delete yarn.lock i see:

```
warning react-scripts > eslint > file-entry-cache > flat-cache > circular-json@0.3.3: CircularJSON is in maintenance only, flatted is its successor.
```

<!--
  If you answered "Yes":
  
    Please note that your issue will be fixed much faster if you spend about
    half an hour preparing it, including the exact reproduction steps and a demo.
    
    If you're in a hurry or don't feel confident, it's fine to report bugs with
    less details, but this makes it less likely they'll get fixed soon.

    In either case, please fill as many fields below as you can.

  If you answered "No":

    If this is a question or a discussion, you may delete this template and write in a free form.
    Note that we don't provide help for webpack questions after ejecting.
    You can find webpack docs at https://webpack.js.org/.
-->

### Environment

```

  System:
    OS: Linux 4.15 KDE neon 5.14
    CPU: x64 Intel(R) Core(TM) i5-4570 CPU @ 3.20GHz
  Binaries:
    Node: 11.1.0 - ~/.nvs/default/bin/node
    Yarn: 1.12.3 - /usr/bin/yarn
    npm: 6.4.1 - ~/.nvs/default/bin/npm
  npmPackages:
    react: ^16.6.3 => 16.6.3 
    react-dom: ^16.6.3 => 16.6.3 
    react-scripts: 2.1.1 => 2.1.1 
  npmGlobalPackages:
    create-react-app: Not Found
```

### Steps to Reproduce

1. `create-react-app appname` 
2. delete yarn.lock inside app folder
3. `yarn`

### Expected Behavior

no warnings! ;-)

### Actual Behavior

```
warning react-scripts > eslint > file-entry-cache > flat-cache > circular-json@0.3.3: CircularJSON is in maintenance only, flatted is its successor.
```
